title: A testimony concerning the life, death, trials, travels and labours of Edward Burroughs that worthy prophet of the Lord who dyed a prisoner for the testimony of Jesus, and the word of God, in the city of London, the 14th of the 12th month, 1662 / [by] F.H.
author: Howgill, Francis, 1618-1669.
publisher: Printed and are to be sold by William Warwick,
notes: Includes contributions by George Whitehead, Josiah Coale and George Fox.
Imperfect: pages stained and with print show-through.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
